Dear Ms. Edmon:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please
contact the area manager at 616-552-3662.
Sincerely,
Nabiha Rizk, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 8/25/23 at 9:00 PM, youth came out of his room and said staff
was being loud. Youth proceeded to walk up in staff’s face. Staff
then slammed youth on the ground. Youth was taken to Beaumont
Hospital, the hospital reported there were "no damages;" however,
youth’s left arm was placed in a soft cast and youth was given
ibuprofen. Staff was sent home and is not allowed to return to the
facility.
Investigation This complaint was received on 08/29/2023 and assigned for joint
investigation with MDHHS Specialist.
I spoke with MDHHS Specialist on 08/29/2023. She reported
Youth A was interviewed by MDHHS Specialist 1 on 08/28/2023
and he reported that Staff 1 slammed him on the floor and bent his
hand back.
I interviewed Director/Complainant on 08/31/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Director reported on 08/25/2023, there
was an incident involving Youth A and Staff 1, Youth A did report
he hurt his hand, but he initially did not report that Staff 1 slammed
him on the floor and bent his hand. Director said Youth A was
taken to the hospital 08/25/2023, his hand examined and x-rayed,
and the exam was normal. An incident report was completed by
the staff that were in the cottage and witnessed the incident. The
staff intervened and removed Staff 1 from the cottage. There were
three other staff in the cottage on the day of the incident. After the
incident Youth A left the cottage and was walking around outside
banging on doors and windows. Director said Staff 1 has no
previous incidents or disciplinary actions. Staff 1 has been put on
administrative leave pending the investigation.
I attempted to interview Youth A at the facility on 08/31/2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A refused to come in
the room and be interviewed.
2

A second attempt was made to interview Youth A at the facility on
09/06/2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A
refused to be interviewed.
I interviewed Staff 1 at the facility on 09/06/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 has been employed at the facility
for 7 months, has completed all new hire training including CPI.
Staff 1 reported on the day of the incident, he was trying to
deescalate Youth B, who was upset about not wanting to come
inside. Youth A came out of his room, started yelling at Staff 1 for
being too loud, and said “I am going to get you fired.” Staff 1 said
Youth A got in his face, tried to punch Staff 1 in the face, Staff 1
grabbed Youth A’s arm and they both fell to the floor. Staff 1
denied slamming, pushing, or doing anything to hurt Youth A. Staff
1 said he tried to block Youth A from hitting him and did not intend
on grabbing his arm. Staff 1 said there were two other staff that
immediately intervened, and he left the cottage after the incident.
Staff 1 said he has worked in CCI’s for many years, and knows
how to handle difficult youths.
I interviewed Youth B at the facility on 09/06/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Youth B recalled the incident and
reported he and Staff 1 were arguing, and Youth A came out of his
room and told Staff 1 he was being too loud. Youth B said Staff 1
grabbed and pushed Youth A, and that’s when Youth A swung at
Staff 1 and they both fell to the floor. Staff 2 and 3 intervened and
removed Staff 1 from the cottage.
I interviewed Youth C at the facility on 09/06/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Youth C reported he was in his room and
heard Staff 1 and Youth A arguing. Youth C said Youth A swung
at Staff 1, and Staff 1 pushed Youth A against the wall and they
both fell on the floor. He heard Staff 1 say, “let’s get busy, I don’t
give a fuck about this job.” Youth C said Staff 2 and 3 immediately
intervened and had Staff 1 leave the cottage.
I interviewed Staff 2 via telephone on 09/19/2023. Staff 2 has
been employed at the facility for 6 years as a Youth Specialist.
Staff 2 reported on 08/25/2023 Youth A came out of his room and
was upset because Staff 1 and Youth B were being too loud. She
saw Youth A get in Staff 1’s face and yell at him but didn’t hear
Staff 1 say anything inappropriate. She said Staff 1 was trying to
verbally deescalate Youth A, but then Youth A swung at Staff 1
and they got into a struggle and both fell to the floor. She said the
incident escalated very fast, so she and Staff 3 immediately
3

intervened and had Staff 1 leave the cottage. She denied Staff 1
bent or hurt Youth A’s hand. Youth A was very angry and left the
cottage after the incident. She said Staff 4 followed Youth A
outside until Youth A returned to the cottage.
I interviewed Staff 3 via telephone on 09/26/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 3 recalled the incident and reported
that he went to deal with Youth B, because Youth B was getting
aggressive with Staff 1. Youth A came out of his room upset and
angry, so Staff 1 tried to verbal deescalate Youth A. He didn’t see
what happened with Youth A and Staff 1, because he was talking
to Youth B in his room. He did not see how Youth A and Staff 1
ended up on the floor, but Staff 1 told him that Youth A was the
one that was being assaultive. He and Staff 2 immediately
removed Staff 1 from the cottage to deescalate the situation. He
said Youth A was not injured and didn’t report that Staff 1
slammed him on the floor.
I interviewed Staff 4 via telephone on 09/26/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 4 reported on the day in question
Staff 1 was trying to get Youth B to go to his room, but Youth B
was upset and started yelling at Staff 1. Youth A came out of his
room angry because Staff 1 and Youth B were being too loud. He
saw Staff 1 and Youth A pushing each other and falling to the
floor. He didn’t see Staff 1 slam Youth A on the floor or bend his
hand. He said Youth A left the cottage and he followed Youth A
outside. Youth A was upset and was hitting and banging on things
with his hand, so he is not sure if that is the reason Youth A’ s
hand was hurting him.
I interviewed Chief Administrator at the facility on 09/21/2023. She
reported due to the incident and investigation Staff 1’s
employment was terminated on 09/19/2023. A 30-day notice will
be submitted for Youth A due to his assaultive behavior, property
destruction, AWOL, and substance abuse.
On 09/27/2023 a MIC predisposition conference held with MDHHS
Specialist and MDHHS Supervisor. There is a finding for
threatened harm of physical injury.
Document Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 08/25/2023 at 8:20pm, completed by
Staff 2. Report noted Youth A came out of his and was
upset that Staff 1 and Youth B were being too loud. Staff 1
tried to deescalate, Youth A got aggressive with Staff 1
and attempted to punch Staff 1. Youth A and Staff 1 got
4

into a tussle and fell to the floor. Staff 2 and 3 separated
the Youth A and Staff 1.
• Medical record for Youth A dated 08/25/2023. Youth A was
examined at Beaumont Hospital on 08/25/2023 for injury to
left hand. Youth A’s left hand was x-rayed and there were
no injuries or bruises. Youth A was prescribed ibuprofen
400 mg.
• Staff 1’s employee file: no disciplinary action.
• Methodist Intervention Standards and Prohibitions Policy
(rev. 09/01/21) outlines discipline standards for youth. The
facility prohibits any form of corporal punishment and/or
inappropriate hands-on intervention such as but not limited
to; pinching, spanking, slapping, hitting, twisting arms,
paddling, pulling hair, grabbing, pushing, and threatening
gestures.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted and documentation reviewed, a
violation is established regarding staff pushing youth to the floor,
which is inappropriate and a prohibited forms of discipline.
However, it could not be determined if that is how Youth A hurt his
hand, because Youth A was observed afterwards hitting and
banging on doors with his hand.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff member lack's ability to perform job duties.
Investigation On September 27, 2023, MDHHS Specialist reported there was a
preponderance of evidence, which resulted in a confirmed case
for Staff. 1.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as Staff 1 has a confirmed
case.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2022C0446042 dated 10/18/22; CAP approved 10/26/22

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
